alert.note: Alert for Anne Arundel; Baltimore; Baltimore City (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 22 at 10:09PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Maryland and northern Maryland, including the following counties: in central Maryland, Anne Arundel. In northern Maryland, Baltimore and Baltimore City. * WHEN...Until 415 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1007 PM EDT, emergency management reported multiple roads closed due to flooding in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baltimore... Glen Burnie... Dundalk... Pasadena... Arbutus... Rosedale... Ferndale... Brooklyn Park... Pumphrey... Linthicum... Edgemere... Lansdowne... Turners Station... Eastpoint... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
